name: Four Seasons Hotel Hong Kong

reviews.text: Great hotel for Central and the IFC complex.
reviews.title: Great location for Central and IFC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short walk via overground walkway from the Airport Express train and the IFC complex (including the IFC mall).
reviews.title: Great hotel, avoid Exec Club

likes.disliked: — Service. Staff is friendly but inefficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great views of Victoria Harbour.
reviews.title: If you want the five star HK experience

likes.liked: — Fantastic service, gorgeous room, very nice spa

reviews.text: Close to the Star Ferry pier
reviews.title: Excellence in the tradition of Four Seasons chain

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel a few years ago when it first opened.
reviews.title: 5 Star PLUS

likes.disliked: — It is expensive however you get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think I can make this relatively brief because there are no words to describe the experience this hotel provides. They go above and beyond every other hotel we have stayed at in the Four Seasons chain (16) and we obviously love the chain. I considered staying at the Peninsula and visited and was very happy with the 4S choice. I liked the location much better, much fresher, and cleaner. You are attached to a very upscale mall, the airport express and all transportation options are steps away. Caprice was amazing and the staff went above and beyond all expectations. The spa is an experience not to be missed with treatment rooms overlooking the harbor. We had a 38th floor corner suite with harbour views, even from the tub. It was hard to leave for dinner when we went back to change, it was so beautiful. Hong Kong is a gorgeous city with so much to do. We slept with our curtains open b/c it was so beautiful at night and we were so excited to get up and explore every day. I dream of returning.
reviews.title: Perfection...exceeds all expectations.

likes.disliked: — smoking area in the bar too large

reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 2 nights en route from London to Perth. We were quite nervous about travelling with our 7 month old son for the first time and about how we would be received with a baby in an upmarket hotel. We needn't have worried! The staff at the Four Seasons were amazing and made our stay absolutely wonderful. The cot that was provided for our baby came complete with blue bumpers as he is a boy, a baby bath with complimentary Johnson's baby toiletries, nappies in the correct size and even a toy for him to play with. The staff were so welcoming and made such a fuss over our son. Our room was beautiful, we were upgraded to a Harbour View room which was fantastic and we ate in the Lounge both evenings and were warmly welcomed - the staff remembered our names from the first night and were fantastic with our son. Everything about this hotel was amazing, I would recommend it to everyone! The location is perfect, the concierge were very knowledgable and so helpful, the rooms are beautiful and every detail has been thought of. I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Amazing stay...even with a baby!

reviews.text: We are seasoned travellers, fortunate to be able to experience high end standards and can be considered high maintenance.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Hong Kong & maybe the best city hotel on the planet

reviews.text: This hotel is simply outstanding. We stayed there for 10 days in February 2008 and found nothing other than perfection. Amazing rooms, public areas, swimming pool, spa, location, shops, food.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Above all else, the staff are incredible.
reviews.title: The FS Hong Kong does not disappoint!

reviews.text: This is about as good as a city hotel can get. The rooms are very spacious with amenities such as a a large flat-screen TV and a flat-screen TV in the bathroom, very nicely furninshed etc, etc. I can not find a single thing to complain about.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Service is excellent, prompt and to very high standards.
reviews.title: Loved it loved it loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback is the location, in the IFC mall. Great if you are into shopping but if not, it is a bit of a walk to more interesting places.
reviews.title: Simply Delightful

reviews.text: No point in asking for a sea-view room, they overlook a part of the HK harbour that is not that scenic.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Some Issues

reviews.text: It's one of the newest hotels in Hong Kong and it did not fail to impress me. The rooms are generously sized, ipod docking station, and L'Ocitanne amenities. I've stayed at Island Shangri-la as well and Four Seasons is now a tough competitor. Specially since the rooms are much more of the modern and contemporary style. Service was impeccable and food was great! Only down side is that the bar closes too early for my liking :)
reviews.title: Four Seasons Hong Kong , A Modern Luxury Hotel with a View

likes.disliked: — The Price is high.. hope they have some promotion in the future !

reviews.text: Having stayed at the hotel for 8 days, i could say i know this hotel very well!
reviews.title: Very good stay but could be perfect

likes.liked: — The Pool!!!!! and some of the staff
likes.disliked: — the icy staff and bathroom design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving at the hotel the door staff were very friendly! and actually lots of the staff, must of heard, "well come to the four seasons," 10 times.
reviews.title: Love this Hotel - the Four Seasons is always consistent in service/details etc

reviews.text: Room was very nice, the entertainment channels are very good selection, beds comfortable. However my first problems start here. As a hotel aimed as business people in the internet could be a least cheap or free! Also the bathroom design was not good, The toilet seat was very werid i its design so hard to sit on and there is quite and big gap between the bathroom doors so you can see people in the bathroom using the shower and the door doesn't have a lock. That means older siblings sharing the room like me means you can't go any where near the bathroom in the room like the wardrobes in a twin room.
reviews.title: Perfection!

likes.disliked: — Having to pay for wireless service

reviews.text: The food at the hotel was very nice, Caprice was amazing even though expensive the portions were large and teh staff were very friendly. Lung king heen, best chinese restaurant in the world was nice, good to have lunch there as you don't have to dress up loads. The lounge was nice for breakfast, though from 250 HK$ you can get a lot of stuff! so not recommnated even you are a light eater!
reviews.title: Four Seasons Hong Kong - a must

reviews.text: Now the best thing about the hotel... the pool!!!! it is amazing espically in summer if you go there then. Its such a haven, with amazing views and service, you do feel like you are on hoilday! the underwater speakers though are a bit quiet, but would stay at Four Seasons again just for the pool.
reviews.title: Another very positive review..

likes.disliked: — Location (great for business, but otherwise taxi is necessary to go anywhere)

reviews.text: Stayed here for five days in October, for a work conference.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: There's probably not much to add to the reviews already on this site - this really is a very good hotel. As an example - I wandered outside when it was just starting to drizzle, and one of the hotel staff ran after me to give me an umbrella.
reviews.title: Spectacular hotel...excellent location

likes.disliked: — pool terrace waiter forgot drink order

reviews.text: Had a harbour view room on the 37th floor - excellent views of Kowloon - for HKD$4200/night inc tax. All the fixtures and fittings are, as you'd expect, pretty decent quality. Only gripe - the TV in the bathroom is positioned straight on, and isn't angled, so you can't actually view it properly when you're in the tub.
reviews.title: First class hotel, Five class service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is open 24 hours (yes!), and has a reasonable selection of equipment - free weights pretty good. Swimming pool was excellent - right in the middle of all these skyscrapers, and with views over to Kowloon.
reviews.title: World Class

reviews.text: Ate in the Cantonese restaurant, Lung King Heen - breakfast and dinner. It was totally deserted in the morning - I guess not many people feel like congee and dumplings - so I had the whole place to myself. Very pleasant, though, and less crowded than the lobby lounge, which is the other option for breakfast. Dinner in Lung King Heen was great - a group of us went on a Tuesday night, expecting it to be empty, but it was actually pretty busy. Typical Cantonese fare - hairy crabs, dumplings, steamed fish etc. Came to about HKD$1000/head.
reviews.title: expect the usual luxury... :)

reviews.text: I just got back from a week on business and stayed at the four seasons.
reviews.title: The best on Hong Kong

likes.disliked: — very expensive food and not great

reviews.text: It was so clean and the service was great.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I was sent to Hong Kong for business, and my company put me up at the Four Seasons Honk Kong. I was here for 7days. I took the train from the airport to Hong Kong Central. There was a hotel driver waiting at the train station for people headed to the Four Seasons. The hotel is basically across the street, but since it was my first time, I'm glad that the driver was there. The hotel van was a very nice Mercedes black van, got a bottle of water from the driver. I would have definitely gotten lost trying to find my way to the hotel from the train station with my suitcases. Bellhop took the suitcases, while I went to check in. The check-in staff was very friendly, they spoke great English. After check-in the lady who checked me in, took me up to my room, and gave me a tour of the room. The room was amazing, very large and comfortable. I was fortunate to have the Deluxe Harbour View Room. Great views of the Harbour and Kowloon. Bellhop arrived promptly with my suitcases. The desk area was very big, the only downside was that you had to pay for internet access. It was about $20 USD ($160 HKD) a day for internet access. The room had a mini bar, but I was able to keep a couple of bottles of water and soda in there to keep them cool, as I did not want to pay for the overpiced mini bar items. The room comes with a flat panel 42" LCD, and DVD player. There is also a smaller LCD in the bathroom. Didn't watch much TV while I was there. You can get to the IFC mall via the hotel lobby by walking past the Blue Bar and taking the escalators upstairs. From the IFC mall you can grab the MTR or the Airport Express train. There are several place to eat in the mall as well as a Starbucks. The hotel restuarants have a business casual dress code. My room came with complimentary breakfast, so you could eat at either restaurant for breakfast. The food was delicious and the service was great. I didn't get a chance to check out the gym or the roof pool, as there was so much to see and do in Hong Kong. The hotel is very expensive and well worth it, not sure if I would have paid for it out of pocket though. Luckily it was all paid for my company. Overall a great stay and a great hotel.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, comfortable bed, great views of the Harbor, close to the IFC mall and public transportation
likes.disliked: — Had to pay for Internet service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel over new year and were absolutely amazed by the room, ambiance and service. This is yet another example of Four Seasons delivering on high quality!
reviews.title: Great place when visiting Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very large, modern and elegant with every necessary (and unnecessary) imaginable amenity with great views of the harbour.
reviews.title: Wonderful. The best hotel ever!

likes.liked: — Fantastic attention to detail; wonderful day spa

reviews.text: The same comments are applicable across all of the rest of the hotel with a wide selection of restaurants, bars and easy access to a large shopping mall and subway.
reviews.title: Usual Four Seasons Excellence

likes.liked: — Pool and spa facilities. Great executive club food and service
likes.disliked: — The route taxis have to take to reach it

reviews.text: As we were visiting such an exciting location, we did not really spend time lounging by the pool, but did visit the poolside bar on a couple of evenings. The pool / bar area has absolutely amazing views - not to be missed !!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: I love the 4 seasons chain so I have become used to great facilities and service which this also has...but heres the rest
reviews.title: As 4 seasons go just average

reviews.text: the pros--location-the view,near the star ferry ,mall and elevators to Hollywood, the beds the bathrooms
reviews.title: WOW and shopping to boot

likes.liked: — the view, the location, the luxury and comfort

reviews.title: One of my favorites
reviews.text: the cons---the elevators(painfully slow), soso dim sum.chinese food averge to bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hong Kong Four Seasons is huge, but its location is excellent. You are near the business district and shopping and it is connected to the nicest upscale mall in Hong Kong. We had a suite with a view of the port which was grand and on a high floor. Service was excellent, there were two big screen televisions in each room as well as a tv in the bathroom mirror.
reviews.title: Good, efficient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mall was great for expensive shopping, but also for its bookstores, beauty salons, cosmetics stores and department stores other than the Valentino, Cucci, Prada and other boutiques located in it.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Asia

reviews.text: I booked a club harbour view room at the Four Seasons for a weekend getaway after a tiring business trip in Shanghai.
reviews.title: Exceed All Expectations !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is by now my 4th stay in Four Seasons and I already know this hotel quite well and what to expect. Little did I know that this hotel once again exceed my expectations! Thus I am compelled to write this new review.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service and Quality

likes.disliked: — Charge for us of internet at the business centre (the only thing we did not like at the property)

reviews.text: Enough have been said about the gorgeous room decor, the spacious room, amenities and the beautiful bathroom. What I noticed this time are all the improvements.
reviews.title: OK but not that great

likes.liked: — Location, handy for Airport Express and City Check In

reviews.text: For example :
reviews.title: Excellent location and good quality

reviews.text: Firstly there is signficant improvement to the already good Four Seasons service. It’s now impeccable, perfect. If in the past, the staff can be said to behave a bit "cold" but efficient, now they are all warm and friendly and loss none of the efficiency. All of them seems to have undergone some training. I was greeted by name and warm smiles everywhere I go and staff will strike up small conversations with me, but not being intrusive when I want to be left alone. I had indigestion ( too much food! ) during one of the days of my stay and they quickly prepare some lime juice and recommend mint tea and porridge as temporary cure. They manager at the club lounge even bring the drinks up to my room!
reviews.title: We Adored It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were planing a stop over for 3 nights on the way home from NZ it was toss up between the Four Seasons & the Peninsular. and wow we made the right choice. The hotel room was wonderful with a breath taking view of Victoria Harbour the room was a executive harbour view room we decided to stay at the executive club and what a treat it was I would strongly reccomend to anyone looking for that special touch to book a room with executive club access the club lounge over looks Victoria harbour and the light show is a spectacle every evening. The additional cost of the executive club gives you access to fullBreakfast, snacks, drinks ,all day alcohol from 11am to 1am afternoon tea and light dinner snacks the choice of food and drinks are amazing and are truly unlimited the service throughout the hotel is impecable. We have stayed at the Peninsular Bejing and thought that was good, but the Four Seasons puts it to shame. Fantastic location, very well trained staff to pamper your every whim. A Truly Amazing Experience
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: If there were a heaven on earth, the Four Seasons Hong Kong tries to replicate it, with a combination of excellent décor, impeccable service, wonderful food and facilities in the heart of one of the world's most exciting cities. Hong Kong has great hotels, but this is one of the few hotels in the world where I would actually like to LIVE. A friend does indeed live there, and she loves it. And what's not to love? I arrived after a long flite from Europe to be the only one on the plane to be greeted by a person holding my name and a cart directly outside the plane, whisking me off through customs and directly to the luggage belt. As soon as I was picked up, I didn't even see another of my flight companions again, I was taken directly to my chauffered car outside and whisked to the hotel, where the wonderful front desk service took me to my room for check in where I had the best view of Hong Kong's night-time panorama. Never in my life have I experienced such excellent service, particularly welcome after a long flight (the Mandarin is similar, but chauffers appear only after you exit airport customs carrying your own luggage). The room had been redecorated, and superbly. I had a more classic, modern room which is precisely to my taste. The hotel is just a bridge (through a great mall) to the centre of the city and my office. However, I loved the short distance which allowed me to unwind after the intensity that is Hong Kong. Loved the state of the art gym and spa. I have travelled, it seems, nearly everywhere but this is one of my two favourite hotel properties on the planet. The other is the George V in Paris. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Hotel Standards Hit New High at the FS HK

likes.disliked: — I wish I had had more time to enjoy the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Seasons HK for 3 nights on our way back to London after 2+ weeks in Australia. it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a deluxe harbour view room on a lower floor (by request) the view was wonderful. the room was great - not one complaint.
reviews.title: Elegant

likes.disliked: — uncharacteristically indifferent service at their Lung King Heen restaurant

reviews.title: Is this the best city hotel in the world?
reviews.text: the housekeeping was excellent, reception, concierge everything & everyone helpful.

What can I say, everything you expect from a Four Seasons hotel - comfortable, modern room; great service; huge place; and the fantastic pool area was probably the highlight of the hotel. Difficult to find any negatives to be honest as everything was excellent, but i suppose with such a big place its not very cosy. Best hotel I've stayed in in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Great city hotel

reviews.text: Our stay at the Four Seasons simply flowed from check in.
reviews.title: "TRULY" 1st Class
Greeeeat Just Great
reviews.text: The documents we had Fedex courier prior to our arrival were immediately handed to us at reception.
The Harbour view from our suite had us relaxed from the moment
reviews.title: Near Perfect

reviews.text: we opened the door.
reviews.title: Wondeful Fou Seasons Experience

likes.disliked: — I had to leave after a week.....

description: On the waterfront overlooking Victoria Harbour and the financial district, Four Seasons redefines luxury and excellence in a city renowned for exceptional accommodations. As part of the prestigious International Finance Centre, it offers unrivalled links to Hong Kong Station, with the famed Star Ferry steps away. In a city known for great dining, Four Seasons Hotel Hong Kong is the only hotel in the world with two Michelin three-star restaurants - Caprice and Lung King Heen.
